decks.notes: This deck is built around the concept of aggressive gameplay combined with disruption and card advantage. The key strategy is to play efficient and powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis, while using cards like Dark Confidant and Deathrite Shaman to gain card advantage. The deck also includes a variety of disruption spells such as Abrupt Decay, Force of Will, and Stifle to disrupt the opponent's plans. Additionally, the deck features cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws and maximize efficiency.

This combo deck aims to quickly generate mana and cast multiple spells in a single turn in order to play the card, Tendrils of Agony, and deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes various fast mana accelerators such as Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with powerful card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. It also utilizes disruption cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo. The overall strategy is to chain together multiple spells to generate a storm count high enough to win the game with Tendrils of Agony.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly by utilizing cards that allow for untapping and tapping of creatures. By casting spells such as Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith, the player can draw and search for key pieces to achieve a quick win condition. The deck includes various creatures with mana-generating abilities that work well together to create a powerful combo, ultimately leading to a massive creature like Craterhoof Behemoth being summoned to attack and win the game in just a few turns.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and mana rocks to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony to win the game. It includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo. Card selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain help find combo pieces and shuffle away unwanted cards. This deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a high storm count for a lethal Tendrils of Agony.

This deck aims to disrupt opponent's game plan with disruptive cards like Force of Will, Abrupt Decay, and Thoughtseize while also generating card advantage with Brainstorm and Ancestral Vision. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Tarmogoyf, Shardless Agent, and Liliana of the Veil to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck can also grind out games with cards like Dig Through Time and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck's spells while also providing enough disruption with cards like Wasteland.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using burn spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and reduce their life total as fast as possible. By running a combination of direct damage spells, aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide, and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Sulfuric Vortex helps to further punish the opponent for playing spells or gaining life.

This Legacy Elves deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while using Glimpse of Nature to draw into key combo pieces. It aims to efficiently search for and play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth using Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. The deck also utilizes Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to generate additional mana and trigger abilities multiple times in a turn. This combo-centric strategy allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with a flood of Elves and finish the game with a massive Craterhoof Behemoth swing.

The main concept of this Infect combo deck is to quickly poison the opponent with creatures that have infect and pump spells to increase their power. The deck includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and mana acceleration to support the aggressive strategy. Cards like Vines of Vastwood, Berserk, and Become Immense are used to deal lethal poison damage in a single turn. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize and defend against the infect creatures.

The deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board. It heavily relies on the synergy between creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mother of Runes, along with powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent through aggressive plays, while also having access to disruptive tools like Gaddock Teeg and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on disruption and card advantage to control the game while also having a powerful aggressive element with Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Liliana of the Veil, while also having the ability to generate card advantage with Ancestral Vision and Baleful Strix. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's three-color strategy, with efficient removal like Abrupt Decay to deal with threats. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and beat them down with efficient creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board early on with efficient removal, counterspells, and tempo plays, while also being able to quickly close out the game with strong threats like True-Name Nemesis and Delver of Secrets. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze and Force of Will, while also having versatile options like Dig Through Time for card selection and advantage. The deck's mana base is optimized to support its multi-color requirements and provide consistency in casting its spells.

The main theme of this deck is disrupting opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. The deck includes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down opponents, while utilizing Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to quickly get threats like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice onto the battlefield. The deck also includes plenty of land disruption with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, making it difficult for opponents to develop their mana base. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption. It also utilizes the Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo to generate an army of flying Thopter tokens. The deck includes a mix of cantrips and card draw spells to ensure consistency and dig through the deck for key pieces. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for reusing powerful spells from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win through its powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to quickly establish a strong board presence and control the game. It also utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Deathrite Shaman and Green Sun's Zenith to ramp up and cast powerful threats like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Gaddock Teeg and Abrupt Decay helps to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect your own creatures. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying efficient threats to close out the game. By utilizing discard spells, countermagic, and removal like Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the battlefield. Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman provide efficient creatures that can pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while maintaining consistency. Liliana of the Veil and Tasigur, the Golden Fang provide additional disruption and card advantage to keep the opponent on the back foot.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on opponents with aggressive creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Delver of Secrets, backed up by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to control the board with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will while using Stoneforge Mystic to fetch powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. By efficiently managing resources and applying pressure early in the game, this deck aims to outpace opponents and secure a victory before they can stabilize.
